title: Main Frame - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

If the motorcycle has recently been running, some components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the motorcycle.
Note the routings of all harnesses for installation.
Note the routings of the brake hoses/pipes for installation.
Drain the brake fluid from the front and rear master cylinder (see
Bleeding the Front Brakes, Renewing Brake Fluid
Bleeding the Rear Brake, Renewing Brake Fluid
Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal
Rear ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal
Collect the final drive chain from the motorcycle.
Note the routing of the front direction indicator harness for installation.
Disconnect the front direction indicators from the main harness.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Disconnect the brake hose from the front brake master cylinder and discard the two sealing washers.
Disconnect the front ABS wheel speed sensor electrical connector from the main harness.
Left hand switch housing electrical connectors
Front ABS wheel speed sensor electrical connector
Note the position of the electrical connectors for installation
Disconnect both electrical connectors from the alternator regulator/rectifier.
Disconnect the front brake switch and right hand switch housing connectors from the main harness.
Right hand switch housing electrical connectors
Disconnect the left hand switch housing connectors from the main harness.
Disconnect the ignition switch connector from the main harness.
Remove and discard the two fixings and remove the instrument cover.
Slide the cover off the electrical connector and disconnect the electrical connector.
Disconnect the two electrical connectors from the engine ECM (see
) and remove the engine ECM and bracket assembly.
Note the routing of the purge control valve hoses for installation.
Press the wire locking device fully in and disconnect the electrical connector from the purge control valve.
Release the fixing and remove the purge control valve and its hoses.
Detach the roll over valve from its bracket.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the ambient air pressure sensor and remove the roll over bracket.
Carefully release the harness retaining clips from the left and right hand sides of the frame. Retain the clips on the harness for installation.
Detach the ABS modulator harness from the coolant expansion tank cover.
Remove the fixings and remove the coolant expansion tank cover.
Note the position of the coolant expansion tank for installation.
Reposition the coolant expansion tank and disconnect the ABS modulator multiplug (see
Disconnect the rear brake light switch from the main harness. Route the main harness side back to the ABS modulator/ECM.
Release the fixing and remove the oxygen sensor bracket. Release the three connectors from the bracket and route them back to the main harness.
The ignition coil wires identified with the red tape are fitted to the right hand side of the ignition coils.
Note the position of the four wires connected to the ignition coils for installation.
Disconnect the four wires from the ignition coils (two either side of the ignition coils).

body.name: Disconnect wires from ignition coils ciwj_1

body.body: Ignition coil connectors (right hand side shown)
Disconnect the electrical connector from the MAP sensor.
Release the three fixings and remove the ignition coils and bracket assembly.
Remove the fixing and detach the coolant filler neck from the immobiliser/TPMS control module bracket.
Note the position of the coolant hoses for installation.
Unclip the coolant hose from the frame and remove the coolant expansion tank and hoses from the motorcycle.
Remove the two fixings (one either side) and detach the immobiliser/TPMS control module and bracket assembly from the frame.
Disconnect the immobiliser/TPMS electrical connector from the main harness.
Release the locking device, detach the main harness electrical connector from the bracket and remove the immobiliser/TPMS control module and bracket assembly.

body.name: Detach connect connector to immobiliser brkt cixz

body.body: Note the positions of the brake line, main harness and clutch cable for installation.
Release the fixings and remove the cable tidy on the left hand side of the headstock.
Release the fixing from the top of the main harness cover, remove the fir tree clip and remove the harness assembly from the motorcycle.
Note the routing of the hoses for installation.
Remove the fuel tank breather hose(s) and, if fitted, the evaporative hose.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Thoroughly clean the area around the ABS modulator prior to disconnecting the brake line unions.
Note the routing and position of all brake lines prior to removal.
Disconnect the rear brake caliper to ABS modulator brake line union and discard the sealing washers. Remove the brake line.
ABS modulator to front caliper connection brake line
ABS modulator to front master cylinder brake line
ABS modulator to rear master cylinder brake line
ABS modulator to rear caliper brake line

Disconnect the rear brake master cylinder to ABS modulator brake line from the ABS modulator and discard the sealing washers. Remove the rear master cylinder, control plate and brake line as an assembly.
Disconnect the front brake line from the connection block underneath the headstock. Discard the sealing washers and remove the front brake line.
Remove the fixing securing the brake line connection block from the frame. Support the brake line.

body.name: Front caliper hose connector block ckcb

body.body: Disconnect the brake line connection block to ABS modulator/ECM brake line at the ABS modulator. Discard the two sealing washers. Remove the brake line.
Disconnect the front brake master cylinder to ABS modulator brake line at the ABS modulator and discard the two sealing washers. Remove the brake line.
Release and discard the three fixings and remove the ABS modulator and bracket as an assembly.
Remove the frame and swinging arm adjusters from the frame.
Remove the fuel tank mounting rubbers.
Release the fixing and remove the side stand switch connector wire guide from the left hand side of the frame.
Release the fir tree clips and remove the two cable guide brackets from the top and left hand side of the frame.
Remove all rubber grommets and caps from the frame noting their position and orientation for installation.
Unhook the seat lock cable at the seat latch assembly end.
Remove the lock plate from the seat lock barrel.
Remove the guide plate from the seat lock barrel and cable.
Rotate the seat lock barrel assembly to route it through the frame and remove from the motorcycle.
Release and discard the two fixings and remove the seat latch assembly from the motorcycle.
Support the handlebars and remove the handlebar clamp fixings.
As an assembly, remove the handlebars. Ensure the master cylinder remains upright.
Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolts.
Loosen and remove the top nut from the steering stem.
remove the steering stem lock nut and washer. Do not remove the adjuster nut at this stage.
Release the four front mudguard to bracket fixings and remove the front mudguard from the motorcycle.
Loosen the pinch bolt at the lower end of the right hand fork.
With the aid of an assistant to support the frame, remove the wheel spindle which is threaded into the left hand fork and remove the wheel.
With the aid of an assistant, release the steering stem adjuster nut and remove the front fork from the frame. Collect the bearings and dust seals.
If fitting a new frame, remove the headstock bearing from the lower yoke (see
Lower Yoke and Headstock Bearings - Removal

Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

If the motorcycle has recently been running, some components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the motorcycle.
